title: Black Jack Dealer
text: The final project for the Physical Computing module.
projectText: A fun, interactive, and fully functional robot that allows users to play Black Jack without a human dealer, while still using physical cards. The project involved developing seamless tracking of blackjack gestures, managing power limitations, ensuring reliable card dispensing, and embedding IR & piezo sensors in the table mat.

title: BinBiotic
text: The outcome of a 3-month group project during the Human-Centered Design Engineering Module.
projectText: BinBiotic - Keeping your waste in the right place. A data-collecting device with state-of-the-art sensors wirelessly measuring bin fullness and predicting overflow using Machine Learning. The project includes an interactive website offering features like collection schedule generator, bin placement optimization, and more for waste managers, and a public interface for transparency on waste management. A works-like prototype was created using GPS antenna and ultrasonic sensors, connected over GSM to a Firebase server.

title: Wi-Fi Controlled Race Car
text: The final lab assessment for my Electronics 1 module.
projectText: In this group project, we built a Wi-Fi-controlled race car using an ESP32 module. The task involved designing the car's chassis, integrating motors, and programming the ESP32 using microPython for remote control via a custom-built web app hosted on the ESP32.

title: Bouncer Challenge
text: The lab in my Solid Mechanics 1 module.
projectText: This project involved predicting the travel distance of a ball dropped from a specific height, bouncing off a surface. The calculations were based on measuring the coefficient of restitution for different ball-surface combinations, followed by comparing predictions to real-world measurements.

title: Materialise Report
text: The report for my Materials module.
projectText: A report selecting an appropriate material for a given application using CES Granta Edupack. The report justifies the choice based on client needs and application specifications.

title: Reverse Engineering Report
text: The report for my Manufacturing module.
projectText: A reverse engineering study aimed at analyzing a given product and suggesting improvements. It involved understanding the manufacturing processes used and exploring ways to enhance the product's design.

title: Truck CFD
text: A solo project focusing on Computational Fluid Dynamics.
projectText: This project involved designing and modeling a pickup truck using SolidWorks and Ansys. The aim was to assess the aerodynamic performance of a new product compared to existing market models like the Ford F150. The simulations and results were validated using hand calculations.

links.desc: Detailed report of the CFD analysis
3D flow trajectories of the truck design

title: TimeLine
text: A group project for Industrial Design Engineering.
projectText: TimeLine is a battery-powered hand-operated device designed to help young adults manage time more effectively, addressing issues like hyperfocus and time blindness. The project involved electronics design, programming, and prototyping using components such as an ESP32, E-Ink display, and Neopixel ring. A functional prototype was built, integrating user feedback for improved functionality.
